items.name: Thermal Innerwear
items.why: Essential for winter months (Oct–Feb); helps reduce layering bulk.

items.name: Winter Jacket
items.why: Highly recommended. Choose between bringing a good-quality one or buying in France.

items.name: Raincoat or Waterproof Jacket
items.why: Rouen experiences frequent rainfall, especially in fall/winter.

items.name: Sweatshirts / Hoodies
items.why: Daily wear during autumn/spring. Light layers are useful indoors too.

items.name: Jeans / Trousers
items.why: Students often face size/fit issues in France, especially in length.

items.name: T-Shirts / Shirts
items.why: Easy to layer. Readily available in France, but cheaper in India.

items.name: Underwear & Socks
items.why: Bring enough for 1–2 weeks. Cotton is preferred; Indian brands are more affordable.

items.name: Sleepwear / Loungewear
items.why: Comfortable clothing for dorms. Bring at least one set.

items.name: Ethnic Wear (Kurta/Saree etc.)
items.why: Optional. Useful for cultural events, Diwali, Onam, etc.

items.name: Shoes (Sneakers / Casual)
items.why: Good-quality shoes are expensive in France. Bring a pair you trust.

items.name: Flip-Flops / Slippers
items.why: Useful for indoors and shared bathrooms (especially in CROUS).

items.name: Thermal Gloves & Cap
items.why: Must-have for winter. Lightweight items that take up little space.

items.name: Formal Shirt / Blazer (1 Set)
items.why: For presentations, interviews, or career fairs. Optional but recommended.

items.name: Scarf / Muffler
items.why: Essential in colder months to avoid flu. Compact and useful.

items.name: Rain Shoes / Waterproof Footwear
items.why: If you walk to class in rain often, this is a lifesaver.
